milStd883Method2011.title: Wire Pull Test (MIL-STD-883 Method 2011)
milStd883Method2011.description: Destructive test to evaluate wire bond strength by pulling the wire loop until failure

hookPlacement.requirement: Hook must be placed at the loop apex (highest point)
hookPlacement.warning: If placed at mid-span, trigonometric forces change, invalidating the data

failureCodes.name: Bond Lift (First Bond)
failureCodes.description: Ball peels off the die pad
failureCodes.indication: Process failure - contamination, low heat, or inadequate ultrasonic energy

failureCodes.name: Neck Break
failureCodes.description: Wire breaks just above the ball at the heat-affected zone
failureCodes.indication: Bond is stronger than the wire itself - optimal failure mode

failureCodes.name: Wire Break (Mid-span)
failureCodes.description: Wire breaks in the middle of the loop
failureCodes.indication: Normal failure if force exceeds minimum requirements

failureCodes.name: Heel Break
failureCodes.description: Wire breaks at the stitch bond heel
failureCodes.indication: May indicate worn tools or excessive ultrasonic power

failureCodes.name: Bond Lift (Second Bond)
failureCodes.indication: Second bond process issue - contamination or inadequate bonding parameters

minimumPullForces.title: Minimum Pull Force Requirements by Wire Diameter

milStd883Method2023.title: Ball Shear Test (MIL-STD-883 Method 2023)
milStd883Method2023.description: Destructive test that pushes a chisel against the side of the ball bond to evaluate weld interface strength
milStd883Method2023.purpose: Pull testing mostly tests wire strength (neck), not the weld interface. Shear test directly evaluates bond quality.

shearHeight.requirement: Chisel positioned at 10-15% of ball height above pad surface
shearHeight.tooHigh: Slices top of gold ball off (false pass)
shearHeight.tooLow: Drags chisel across aluminum pad (invalid test)
shearHeight.typical: 2-5 µm above pad for 25 µm wire

shearMode.pass: Gold remnant visible on pad after shear
shearMode.fail: Clean pad (silver/aluminum color) indicates ball lift

dieShearTest.title: Die Shear Test
dieShearTest.description: Tests the adhesion of the silicon die to the substrate/leadframe
dieShearTest.note: Die Shear tests die attach adhesive, not wire bonds. Ball Shear is used for wire bond evaluation.
dieShearTest.minimumForce: Depends on die size - typically 2.5 kg/mm² of die area

crateringTest.title: Cratering Test (Copper Wire Critical)
crateringTest.description: Evaluates subsurface damage to silicon under bond pads
crateringTest.issue: Copper wire is harder than silicon die. Bonding can create invisible micro-cracks under the bond pad that pass electrical tests but fail later.
procedure: Chemically etch away the metal bond pad using Potassium Hydroxide (KOH) or similar
Look for conchoidal fractures (scalloped divots) in the silicon
preventionMethods: Use ramp-up ultrasonic energy (start low, increase slowly)
Use higher frequency bonding (120 kHz) which uses less amplitude
Use softer wire materials or Pd-coated copper
